courseDetails.title: P.O.W.E.R. : Proven Interview System to crack your DREAM job
courseDetails.shortDescription: 7-Step Proven System to convert every job interview into a job offer
courseDetails.longDescription:
Proven Interview System 3.0 - The #1 BEST-SELLING Job Interview Course! (with over 480 ratings)


>> COURSE REGULARLY UPDATED (Last updated:  FEBRUARY 2024): NEW TIPS, MORE LESSONS <<

>> CERTIFIED COACH, SPEAKER, AND TRAINER <<

>> OVER 346,000 STUDENTS IN TOTAL <<


Preparing for an interview takes a lot more than Googling a list of common interview questions. You have to make a great first impression, you will have to have a great knowledge of your target company and its product, and, of course, know exactly how to convey that you're the perfect fit for the job.

There is no one “best” way to prepare for an interview. Rather, there are specific and important strategies to enhance one’s chances for interview success. Every interview is a learning experience. Learning that takes place during the preparation and actual interview process is useful for future interviews


The interview is one of the most important elements in the job search process. When an employer invites you to an interview, he/she is indicating an interest in bringing you on board. The interview gives both of you the opportunity to exchange enough information to determine if you are a good "fit" for each other.


The biggest mistake in interviewing is not being fully prepared. It behooves job-seekers to use every conceivable means possible to prepare for the interview and to allow ample time to fully prepare.


Understand that interviewing is a skill; as with all skills, preparation, and practice enhance the quality of that skill. Preparation can make the difference between getting an offer and getting rejected. You should use the limited amount of time you have to learn about an employer's needs and discuss the ways you can meet these needs.


Think of an interview as a highly focused professional conversation. In many cases, you will interview at least twice before being hired for a position. Once in a brief screening interview and at least once again in a more serious meeting when you may also speak with many of your potential co-workers.

courseDetails.title: Governmental Accounting 100
courseDetails.shortDescription: Fund accounting-governmental accounting-General Fund & government-wide activity transactions-modified accrual method
courseDetails.longDescription:
Governmental accounting, including fund accounting financial transactions, focusing on the general fund and government-wide activities.

We will work through many example problems as we learn the material, posting transactions to a trial balance, so we can see how accounts behave. Many governmental accounts are new to many learners, and we will be using different accounting methods than just an accrual method. Posting transactions and seeing a trial balance will be very helpful in learning the material and is something lacking in most courses on the subject.

We will discuss the governmental accounting objectives and reporting requirements, comparing them to for-profit entities. The course will assume we are familiar with for-profit accounting and will, therefore, focus on the areas of governmental accounting that are different, although we will continue to work with core concepts like the double entry accounting system.

Learners and instructor will examine state and local governmental accounting principles & financial reporting.

We will record transactions for budgetary accounts & encumbrances. Recording budgetary accounts will be new for many learners familiar with financial accounting, but we will use double entry accounting principles for the process.

The course will explain and analyze governmental operating statement accounts & budgetary accounts.

Learners and instructor will record transactions for encumbrances, expenditures, & delinquent receivables. We will emphasize when a modified accrual method will be used, and what the differences in recording financial transactions will be when used, as compared to an accrual method.

We will record transactions related to revenue in both the General Fund and at the government-wide activities level.

The course will discuss tax anticipation notes and how they will be recorded under a modified accrual method.

Learners and instructor will explore many examples of the closing process, closing out temporary accounts. We will compare the closing process for governmental entities to the closing process in for-profit accounting.

We will examine how to create subsidiary ledgers related to revenue, estimated revenue, appropriations, encumbrances, and expenditures.

The course will provide examples of recording supplies using the consumption method and purchases method, explaining the differences between the two.
targetAudiences: Accounting students
CPA Exam Candidates

courseDetails.title: QuickBooks Online – Bank Feeds & Credit Card Feeds
courseDetails.shortDescription: Learn bank feeds and how to use them from a practicing CPA (certified public accountant)
courseDetails.longDescription:
This course will jump right into bank feeds and how to use them.

Most QuickBooks courses will spend a lot of time talking about how a full-service accounting system works using QuickBooks. We do recommend spending time learning the full accounting process, and we do have a course that does this.

However, many small businesses want to get right down to data input as fast as possible, and others already have a good understanding of the system and want to focus specifically on bank feeds.

This course will do just that.

For example, some small businesses may be perfectly happy using a cash basis system and will, therefore, not need some of the functions used in a full accounting cycle. Businesses that use a cash basis model can structure their data input to be much more heavily dependent on the bank and bank feed data.

We will discuss types of businesses that fit well into a cash basis model as we work through the practice problems. We will also discuss some problem areas many businesses have and how to set up a system that works.

This course will work through a practice problem and will provide test data that learners can use in their system to follow along if they choose.

One obstacle to learning bank feeds is access to a clean QuickBooks file to practice with. Here are some options you can use along with this course:

Intuit (the owner of QuickBooks) provides a free test drive available to anybody. You can find it by searching in your favorite browser (QuickBooks Test Drive).

Intuit often provides (almost always) a 30 day discount period. You can use the 30 days to practice by starting the 30-day trial, practicing with the data we provide in the course, and then canceling after the 30 days.

Intuit also provides discounts or a free version for students and educators.

Check with your accountant or CPA firm, and they may be able to provide a discount on QuickBooks Online
targetAudiences: Business owners who want an easy system to track data
Bookkeepers who want to understand how bank feeds work
Students who want to apply theory to practical accounting software

courseDetails.title: Tax & Adjusting Entry Year-End Accounting Excel Worksheet
courseDetails.shortDescription: Build Excel worksheet for adjusting adjusting & tax entries, reconciling net income calculated on a book and tax basis
courseDetails.longDescription:
Create a new Excel worksheet from scratch to be used in the adjusting and tax entry process.

This course is most beneficial to tax preparers and public accountants who enter adjusting entries but is also useful to anybody in accounting. Similar Excel worksheets to the ones we will construct can be useful for analyzing many areas of accounting, and the Excel skills learned in creating them are also very applicable both inside accounting and outside of it.

We will discuss the reasons for creating an adjusting and tax entries Excel worksheet. Some benefits of the Excel worksheet include the ability to enter adjusting entries in an efficient way and build an adjusted trial balance, the ability to enter tax entries efficiently and build a trial balance on a tax basis, and the ability to reconcile book net income and tax net income.

An Excel worksheet can be used to show the difference between net income on the unadjusted trial balance, the adjusted trial balance, and tax trial balance in an easy visual way. A worksheet can be used as a reference to communicate to supervisors, clients, and as a reference for us to look back at in the future.

The course will build an Excel worksheet from scratch providing tools to help with the construction for each step along the way. We will provide an updated Excel worksheet for most steps, allowing us to jump forward or to rework any part of the course without starting over. The Excel worksheets will generally have at least two tabs, one with the completed step, showing the end product, and one that has been completed up to the current step in the process, allowing us to fill it in with the help of the instructional video and the Excel tab showing the completed work.

We will then practice entering some adjusting entries and tax entries into the worksheet. As we add adjusting and tax entries to the Excel worksheet, we will better understand how the worksheet is formatted and how best to use it. We will see how net income is calculated on a book basis, on a tax basis, and how the worksheet will show the reconciliation of the two.

This course is not designed to give tax advice but to show how to construct an Excel worksheet to track adjustments.

The course will also discuss some alternative formats for building an adjusting entry and tax entry worksheet that can be found in practice. We will discuss the pros and cons of the different formats.

We will also discuss how to format an adjusting and tax entry worksheet made in the prior year so that we can enter the current year trial balance and data into it.

In addition to the instructional videos, this course will include downloadable  

•    QuickBooks Pro Desktop 2019 Backup files

•    Excel practice files
targetAudiences: Tax professionals who want to reconcile book net income and tax net income
Public accountants who work with adjusting entries

courseDetails.title: Migra un Sitio Web de WordPress a otro Dominio o Hosting
courseDetails.shortDescription: Migra un sitio web de WordPress a otro dominio o hosting, sin saber de programación, de forma fácil y simple.
courseDetails.longDescription:
¿DESEAS APRENDER A MIGRAR UN SITIO WEB DE WORDPRESS A OTRO DOMINIO O HOSTING?


Únete a nuestro curso para mostrarte cómo migrar un sitio web de WordPress completo a otro dominio o hosting, para dicho proceso, podemos utilizar uno de estos dos plugins: All in One WP Migration o SiteGround Migrator.


All in One WP Migration es un plugin que facilita la migración de un sitio hecho en WordPress de forma rápida y sencilla.


Permite exportar todo el contenido como entradas, post, plugins, base de datos, imágenes, temas, etc.


Para realizar este proceso no necesitas ningún tipo de conocimiento técnico ni de programación, ya que se realiza de una forma fácil y veloz.


Para migrar un sitio web en WordPress con el plugin All in One WP Migration, básicamente hay que realizar los siguientes pasos:

  • Instalar el plugin All-in-One WP Migration.

  • Dar clic al botón de exportar para compilar tu base de datos, archivos de medios, plugins, y temas en un archivo compacto.

  • Desempacar el archivo en la nueva ubicación o dominio con una función de “arrastrar y soltar” fácil de usar en el panel de WordPress de tu nuevo sitio web.


SiteGround Migrator es un plugin gratuito de WordPress desarrollado por SiteGround que nos ayuda a migrar un sitio web con WordPress a tu cuenta en SiteGround desde cualquier otra compañía de alojamiento web.


Para migrar un sitio web en WordPress con el plugin SiteGround Migrator, básicamente hay que realizar los siguientes pasos:

  • Generar un token de migración en el Site Tools de SiteGround.

  • Instalar el plugin SiteGround Migrator en tu WordPress.

  • Pegar el token de migración en el plugin para comenzar la migración.

  • Comprobar tu sitio y actualizar los registros DNS para terminar la migración.

courseDetails.shortDescription: Aprende a como crear correos corporativos con dominio propio en Gmail, de forma fácil y simple.
courseDetails.longDescription:
¿CUÁLES SON LAS VENTAJAS DE TENER CORREOS CORPORATIVOS PARA TU NEGOCIO?


Mejor imagen corporativa: Es la primera ventaja que surge de contar con un dominio propio. Le aporta seriedad, confianza y autoridad a tu marca ante tus clientes y proveedores.


De este modo, el dominio te ayuda a mostrar una imagen que refleje compromiso y confianza, y además es una forma de permitir que los usuarios identifiquen fácilmente tu negocio online.


Y es que no genera mucha confianza una empresa cuyo correo electrónico sea una cuenta de Gmail o de Outlook (Hotmail).


Comunicación más efectiva: Muchos emprendedores suelen mezclar las soluciones de comunicación efectivas con las que son de carácter gratuito.


Con esto nos referimos a que elegir una cuenta de correo electrónico gratuito significa quedar atado a ciertas características indeseables. Imaginemos que le enviamos una propuesta interesante a uno de nuestros mejores clientes. Es posible que, ese email termine perdido en la bandeja de Spam, por lo que se aumentan las probabilidades de que nunca sea abierto.


Un gran porcentaje de cuentas gratuitas se utiliza para hacer spam y tus mail pueden ser catalogados de la misma manera si son de cuentas gratuitas. Es un riesgo que no vale nada la pena.


Así pues, contar con un dominio propio hará que tus clientes reciban con seguridad todos tus emails con promociones e información que podría interesarles en su bandeja de entrada principal, por lo que no perderás ninguna oportunidad.


Mejor gestión de información y comunicación: Una de las mejores ventajas de contar con un dominio para los correos electrónicos de tu empresa, es que este te permite crear listas o grupos de trabajo. De este modo, tus colaboradores podrán comunicarse de una manera más sencilla y profesional, al mismo tiempo que aumentan el rendimiento del trabajo en equipo.


Garantiza tu privacidad: sino lo sabías, al crear una cuenta de email en una empresa como Google, debes aceptar obligatoriamente sus políticas de privacidad. Esto significa que Google tendrá acceso a tu información, por lo que esta será usada para mostrarte publicidad personalizada.


En cambio, con un dominio y servidor propio, tendrás la tranquilidad de mantener los datos y la información de tu empresa en buenas manos, pues tu empresa de hosting te garantiza no compartir esta información con terceros. Así, solo tu tendrás control absoluto de tu información.


Mayor seguridad de tus correos: al momento de gestionar una cuenta de correos esto es muy importante. Casi todos los servicios de correos corporativos tienen mayores medidas y protocolos de seguridad ante el posible hackeo o ataque a través de virus por terceros. Existen antivirus, firewalls y filtros anti-spam muy avanzados para proteger tu información confidencial, tus cuentas, dispositivos y equipos.

courseDetails.title: Professional Diploma in Agile and Project Management
courseDetails.shortDescription: Project Management, Agile Frameworks, SCRUM, Kanban, Process Optimisation (Lean, Six Sigma) in IT, Product Development
courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to course: Professional Diploma in Agile and Project Management by MTF Institute


Course provided by MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance

MTF is the global educational and research institute with HQ at Lisbon, Portugal, focused on higher & professional hybrid (on-campus and online) education at areas: Business & Administration, Science & Technology, Banking & Finance.

MTF R&D center focused on research activities at areas: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Cryptocurrency & Digital Assets, Metaverses, Digital Transformation, Fintech, Electronic Commerce, Internet of Things.

MTF is the official partner of: IBM, Intel, Microsoft, member of the Portuguese Chamber of Commerce and Industry, and resident of the incubator "The Fintech House of Portugal".

MTF is present in 203 countries and has been chosen by more than 200,000 students.


Course topics:

Course focused to high-level view of project and flexible management frameworks and its practical usage at product development, IT and other types of tasks. Course will be interesting as introduction to different frameworks for managers of wide types of domains.


  1. Project Management: Project management is the discipline of planning, executing, controlling, and closing a project effectively and efficiently to achieve specific goals while considering constraints such as time, budget, and resources.

  2. Agile: Agile is a project management and product development approach that prioritizes flexibility, collaboration, customer feedback, and the delivery of incremental, functional pieces of a project. It emphasizes adaptability and iterative progress.

  3. Scrum: Scrum is an Agile framework for managing and delivering work, often used in software development. It involves time-boxed iterations (Sprints), roles like Scrum Master and Product Owner, and specific ceremonies (Daily Stand-ups, Sprint Planning, Sprint Review).

  4. Lean: Lean is a philosophy and methodology focused on eliminating waste, optimizing processes, and providing maximum value to customers. It originated from manufacturing but has applications in various industries.

  5. Six Sigma: Six Sigma is a data-driven methodology for process improvement that aims to reduce defects and variations. It uses the DMAIC (Define, Measure, Analyze, Improve, Control) approach to systematically improve processes.

  6. Kanban: Kanban is a visual project management method that helps teams manage and optimize workflow. It uses visual boards with cards representing work items to limit work in progress and improve the flow of work through the system.


Learning about project management, agile and flexible management approaches (such as Agile, Scrum, and Kanban), and process improvement frameworks (Lean and Six Sigma) is of paramount importance for companies and professionals alike. These concepts play a crucial role in modern business operations and can significantly impact the career growth of managers. Here's why they are important:

  1. Effective Project Execution: Project management provides the essential skills and techniques to plan, execute, and control projects efficiently. It ensures that projects are completed on time, within budget, and with the desired quality. Companies benefit from this because it minimizes risks, enhances productivity, and delivers successful outcomes.

  2. Adaptability and Responsiveness: Agile and flexible management approaches, like Agile, Scrum, and Kanban, emphasize adaptability and quick response to changes. In today's fast-paced business environment, the ability to pivot and adapt to shifting priorities and customer demands is crucial. Managers who understand and apply these principles can help their companies stay competitive.

  3. Improved Collaboration: Agile and flexible management approaches promote collaboration among cross-functional teams. This collaboration leads to better communication, problem-solving, and innovation. Companies that foster collaboration are more likely to create a positive work environment and produce superior results.

  4. Efficiency and Waste Reduction: Lean and Six Sigma are process improvement frameworks that focus on eliminating waste and reducing defects. By learning and implementing these concepts, companies can streamline their operations, reduce costs, and improve customer satisfaction. Managers who can optimize processes add substantial value to their organizations.

  5. Customer-Centric Approach: Agile and Lean principles stress the importance of focusing on the customer's needs and delivering value. Companies that adopt these approaches are more likely to build customer loyalty and gain a competitive edge. Managers who understand how to prioritize customer-centricity can drive business growth.

  6. Risk Mitigation: Both project management and agile methodologies emphasize risk management. Understanding how to identify, assess, and mitigate risks is crucial for ensuring project success and minimizing unexpected setbacks. Companies value managers who can navigate potential pitfalls.

  7. Career Advancement: For managers, mastering these concepts can be a significant career booster. It opens up opportunities for leadership roles, promotions, and higher compensation. Companies often seek candidates with expertise in project management and agile methodologies to drive their business forward.

  8. Global Competence: Many of these principles are internationally recognized and applied. Learning them equips managers with the skills needed to work in a global business environment, where teams and projects span across borders. This global competence is highly valuable in today's interconnected world.

  9. Innovation and Continuous Improvement: Agile, Lean, and Six Sigma encourage a culture of innovation and continuous improvement. Managers who promote these values within their teams can help their companies stay ahead of the competition and adapt to changing market conditions.

  10. Employee Satisfaction: Companies that utilize these management and improvement approaches often have more engaged and satisfied employees. Managers who understand how to apply these methodologies not only improve company performance but also foster a positive work environment, which is beneficial for talent retention and attracting top talent.

Learning about project management, agile and flexible management approaches, and process improvement frameworks is essential for companies to thrive in today's business landscape. For managers, mastering these concepts is a career-enhancing move that can lead to personal and professional growth, as well as opportunities to make a substantial impact within their organizations.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. Course for any who want to build the career at management

courseDetails.title: The Eight Crafts of Writing: The Map of Storytelling
courseDetails.shortDescription: The Eight Crafts of Writing course provides a structured overview of the writing craft(s), the map of storytelling.
courseDetails.longDescription:
Jane is an aspiring writer, who, like everyone else before her, parachutes straight into the writing jungle. And, like everybody else, she find herself hung up on a tree with her parachute. The tree is the writing skill How to Write in Limited POV. She looks around and notices a hundred more trees from which other aspiring writers are dangling. She cuts the parachute lines, drops to the ground, makes a somersault forward, and jumps to her feet. Around her, writers of all ages are cutting paths through the jungle. Jane can see just ten meters into the thicket. She is desperate for a map and a navigation system.

“Help,” she calls.

Well-meant answers arrive from all directions. ”Create an interesting character and give her a great goal.”

“Write what you want to read.”

“Create a sense of wonder.”

“The more conflict, the better.”

“Don’t write to get published, grab the reader.”

“Be captivating. Or memorable.”

“Keep the reader turning pages.”

“Be unpredictable and keep the reader curious.”

Five years later, Jane is still cutting her way through the writing wilderness. She has hugged countless writing skill trees, sun-tanned at the romance beach, ascended the suspense mountain, and hiked the Hero’s Journey track. But the storytelling jungle remains unchartered land. What else is out there? She still hopes for a map and navigation system.
targetAudiences: The Eight Crafts of Writing course is great for aspiring writers and writers who are a few years into their writing journey but got lost in the weeds - as it happened to the author.

courseDetails.title: Create snake with Python PyGame
courseDetails.shortDescription: Introduction to game development
courseDetails.longDescription:
This course teaches you how to make the 2d game snake with Python. You will learn to use the module pygame. pygame is a Python game development library designed for use with the The Python programming language. pygame is designed to provide low level access to audio, keyboard, mouse, joystick, and graphics as well as high level modules for tasks such as video playback.

The snake game is the most classic and influential arcade game in the video game universe, It is a video game classic that has been played by many players since its inception. It used to be on an arcade machine but these days is available even in phones.

pygame is a set of Python bindings for the SDL multimedia library. It works with a variety of operating systems and hardware platforms, including Linux with Raspberry Pi, Microsoft Windows, Apple Mac OS X, BeOS, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, Sharp Zaurus, iPAQ, HTC Dream phone and even Android.

General Python knowledge is required. We will use object orientated programming concepts and another module called random to generate random numbers for our game. While the course shouldn't be to difficult to grasp, knowledge of object orientated programming like classes and objects are recommended.

Upon completing this course you'll be able to make your own 2d games, have a working snake game and have basic game development skills. All source code is included with this course.
targetAudiences: Intermediate Python programmers

courseDetails.title: Create Space Invaders with Python PyGame
courseDetails.shortDescription: A beginners course
courseDetails.longDescription:
In this course you learn how to make the game space invaders with Python. You can use this knowledge to make other video games. It is a beginners course, you don't need any knowledge of object orientated programming. You will learn the basics of pygame and be able to make different games.

pygame is a set of Python modules designed for writing games. Pygame supports all common computer operating systems, including Windows, Mac OS X and Linux. With this module you can make all kinds of 2d games, you can display images, play sounds and lots more.

Pygame is designed to create real-time computer games, but without the low-level mechanics of the C programming language and its derivatives. It is one of the module popular modules for creating video games with Python. The pygame module is oriented towards real-time games, not static widget games.

If you are new to Python and want to make games, this course is for you. You will create your own version of space invaders and be able to make different types of games, even if you are not an advanced Python programmer. The course goes step by step over the steps required to make the game. Only basic Python programming knowledge is required for this course.
targetAudiences: Beginner Python programmers that want to make a game

Course Full Description and Welcome Letter:

Hello!

This online course is designed for beginners and for the ones who already have an experience in business.

This course contains a lot of information for leveling up the business skill and knowledge, and helps to know new methods, techniques and approaches, which you can use in management.


The Crucial Role of Coaching Techniques in Managerial Leadership and Career Development


In today's competitive corporate landscape, the role of a manager goes far beyond traditional tasks of overseeing operations and ensuring productivity. A successful manager is now expected to act as a leader, a mentor, and a coach, guiding their team members towards individual and collective success. This paradigm shift highlights the significance of coaching techniques in the realm of managerial responsibilities.

This article delves into the importance of utilizing coaching techniques in the workplace, particularly within the role of a manager or leader. We will explore how coaching knowledge is pivotal for career development, the responsibilities of middle and top managers in preparing and mentoring personal development plans for team members, and the critical role of coaching in internal education and employee development. Additionally, we will examine how coaching methods contribute to the mental health and well-being of employees, acting as a vital support system for individuals who may have limited access to other sources of guidance.


The Transformation of Managerial Roles


1.1 Evolving Leadership Expectations

The traditional image of a manager as a stern authority figure has given way to a more holistic view of leadership. Managers are now expected to serve as role models, motivators, and mentors to their teams. This shift stems from the recognition that employees perform at their best when they feel valued, supported, and empowered.


The evolution of leadership expectations can be traced back to the changing dynamics of the modern workplace. In the past, managers were primarily responsible for enforcing rules and ensuring productivity. However, as organizations began to realize that employee engagement and satisfaction were crucial for success, a transformation in managerial roles ensued.


Today, managers are not just tasked with overseeing tasks and projects; they are expected to inspire and empower their teams. This shift is partly a response to the changing nature of work itself. In a knowledge-based economy, where creativity, innovation, and adaptability are paramount, traditional top-down management no longer suffices.


1.2 Coaching as a Leadership Skill

Coaching has emerged as a pivotal leadership skill that fosters personal and professional growth. We'll explore how coaching techniques, such as active listening, constructive feedback, and goal-setting, can empower managers to become effective leaders who inspire and guide their teams towards excellence.


Coaching is not a one-size-fits-all approach; it is a dynamic and personalized method of leadership. Effective coaches adapt their style to the needs and preferences of individual team members. They actively listen to understand the unique challenges and aspirations of each employee, fostering a sense of trust and rapport.


Moreover, coaching is not merely about providing solutions but guiding employees to discover answers themselves. This approach instills a sense of ownership and accountability in team members. It encourages them to take the initiative, think critically, and develop problem-solving skills—a valuable asset in today's fast-paced, ever-changing business landscape.


Coaching also plays a crucial role in setting and achieving goals. Effective managers use coaching techniques to collaboratively define clear, actionable objectives with their team members. This process not only aligns individual efforts with organizational goals but also empowers employees to track their progress and make necessary adjustments along the way.


Coaching Knowledge for Career Development


2.1 Career Development in the Modern Workplace

In today's highly competitive job market, career development is a top priority for employees. Discover how coaching knowledge equips managers with the tools to help team members navigate their career paths, set meaningful goals, and continually improve their skills.


Career development has evolved from being a peripheral concern to a central focus in the modern workplace. In an era marked by rapid technological advancements and industry disruptions, employees recognize the importance of continuous learning and skill enhancement to remain relevant and competitive.


This heightened emphasis on career development places managers at the forefront of helping their team members chart their professional journeys. Coaching knowledge equips managers with the ability to provide guidance that is not only aligned with the organization's needs but also tailored to the aspirations of individual employees.


One of the key advantages of coaching in career development is its ability to facilitate self-awareness. Effective coaches help employees identify their strengths, weaknesses, interests, and values. Armed with this self-knowledge, employees can make informed career decisions that align with their passions and long-term goals.


2.2 The Manager as a Career Development Partner

Explore the responsibilities of middle and top managers in preparing and mentoring personal development plans for their team members. Learn how these plans can align with organizational objectives and create a win-win situation for both employees and the company.


Managers who actively engage in career development become indispensable partners in their employees' professional growth. They play a pivotal role in creating personalized development plans that leverage individual strengths and address areas needing improvement.


These development plans not only benefit the employees but also the organization. By aligning individual development goals with the company's strategic objectives, managers ensure that every team member's growth contributes to the overall success of the business.


Furthermore, coaching techniques are instrumental in fostering a growth mindset within teams. Managers can use coaching to encourage employees to embrace challenges, persist in the face of setbacks, and view failures as opportunities for learning and improvement. This mindset shift has a profound impact on team performance and innovation.


Coaching for Internal Education and Employee Development


3.1 The Role of Managers in Internal Education

Managers often bear the responsibility of nurturing a culture of learning within their teams and organizations. Explore how coaching methods can be instrumental in identifying and addressing skill gaps, fostering innovation, and supporting ongoing employee development.


In the rapidly evolving landscape of business, organizations that prioritize learning and development gain a competitive edge. Managers are at the forefront of this initiative, serving as the catalysts for continuous improvement and innovation within their teams.


Coaching methods play a pivotal role in identifying and addressing skill gaps. By regularly assessing the competencies of their team members, managers can tailor training and development programs to bridge these gaps effectively. This proactive approach not only enhances individual skills but also bolsters the organization's overall capabilities.


Moreover, coaching encourages a culture of innovation. Effective coaches inspire creativity and critical thinking in their teams. They challenge employees to question the status quo, explore new ideas, and experiment with novel approaches. In this way, managers act as innovation champions, driving progress and adaptability.


3.2 Coaching as a Tool for Employee Empowerment

Employee empowerment is a cornerstone of effective leadership. Coaching techniques provide managers with the tools to empower their team members by fostering a sense of ownership and autonomy in their roles.


One of the primary ways coaching empowers employees is by promoting self-directed learning. Instead of relying solely on formal training programs, employees learn to identify their development needs and take initiative in seeking resources and opportunities for growth. Managers who coach effectively encourage this proactive approach.


Furthermore, coaching cultivates a growth-oriented mindset among employees. When team members receive regular feedback, both positive and constructive, they become more receptive to continuous improvement. They view challenges as opportunities for growth and development, which ultimately leads to higher levels of engagement and performance.


By creating an environment where continuous learning is celebrated, managers inspire their teams to thrive in an ever-changing business landscape. This culture of learning becomes a strategic advantage for organizations, as it enables them to adapt quickly to new challenges and opportunities.


Coaching for Mental Health and Well-being


4.1 The Manager as a Trusted Support System

For many employees, especially those who live alone or lack a strong support network, a manager can become their most trusted confidant. Understand how coaching methods extend beyond professional development to support the mental health and well-being of team members.


The relationship between a manager and their team members extends beyond the confines of the workplace. In some cases, a manager may be the primary source of support for an employee, especially when they are facing personal challenges or seeking guidance related to their mental health and well-being.


Coaching methods are not limited to career development; they encompass the whole spectrum of an employee's life. Effective managers create an environment where team members feel comfortable discussing personal challenges and seeking guidance when needed. This trust and openness are essential for maintaining employee well-being.


In situations where employees are dealing with stress, anxiety, or other mental health issues, managers with coaching skills can provide valuable support. They can listen empathetically, offer guidance on stress management techniques, and help employees access appropriate resources for professional help when necessary.


4.2 Coaching for Life Questions and Personal Challenges

Life is filled with complexities, and employees often grapple with personal challenges that can affect their work performance and overall well-being. Managers who are skilled in coaching can offer valuable guidance during these times of need.


One area where coaching is particularly beneficial is work-life balance. In today's fast-paced world, employees often struggle to juggle their professional and personal responsibilities. Managers can use coaching techniques to help team members set boundaries, manage their time effectively, and achieve a healthier work-life balance.


Coaching also proves invaluable in navigating interpersonal relationships, both within and outside the workplace. Managers can offer insights into effective communication, conflict resolution, and building positive relationships, which can significantly impact an employee's overall quality of life.


In times of personal crisis or uncertainty, such as major life transitions or unexpected challenges, employees may turn to their managers for guidance. Managers trained in coaching can provide a supportive and non-judgmental space for employees to explore their feelings, identify potential solutions, and develop action plans to address these challenges.



In conclusion, coaching techniques have become indispensable in the modern workplace, particularly within the roles of managers and leaders. These skills not only drive career development and internal education but also play a crucial role in supporting the mental health and well-being of employees.

As we navigate an ever-changing professional landscape, organizations that recognize the importance of coaching will not only foster a culture of continuous improvement but also cultivate a loyal and motivated workforce. Managers who embrace coaching as a core aspect of their leadership style will not only elevate their own careers but also become catalysts for the success of their teams and organizations as a whole.

By understanding and implementing coaching techniques effectively, managers can truly transform the workplace into an environment where individuals thrive, careers flourish, and holistic well-being is nurtured.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. Course for any who want to build the career at management, coaching, mentorship or get to know themselves better, for people working in helping areas, for coaches.

courseDetails.title: Threat Intelligence
courseDetails.shortDescription: An Introduction to Threat Intelligence
courseDetails.longDescription:
Threat intelligence is data collected, processed, and analyzed to understand a threat actor's motivations, goals, and attack behavior. Threat intelligence enables us to make faster, more informed, data-driven security decisions and shift behavior from reactive to proactive in the fight against threat actors.

Threat intelligence is the analysis of data using tools and techniques to generate meaningful information about existing or emerging threats that target an organization and help reduce risk. Threat intelligence helps organizations make faster, more informed security decisions and shift their behavior from reactive to proactive to mitigate attacks.

In this course you will learn how to scan urls for malicious software (malware), how to scan a web page, how to use threat intelligence tools and botnets. The internet is full of threat and these are only some of the threats you can face when using the internet. The course is aimed at beginners, who are new to Cyber Security. You don't need any prior knowledge before starting the course.

By the end of the course, you'll be able to determine if a link (url) is malicious before clicking on it. You'll be able to browse various botnet, malware databases and you'll be able to access a list of the most recent malicious links found on the internet. After completing the course, you'll have an idea about Cyber Security and will be a little safer on the net.
targetAudiences: Beginner Cyber Security Professionals
Beginner Ethical Hackers

courseDetails.title: Beginner Guide to Learn T-Shirt Design With Photoshop
courseDetails.shortDescription: Photoshop for T-Shirt Design: A Beginner-Friendly Guide to Creating Stunning Designs
courseDetails.longDescription:
Embark on a comprehensive journey to master the art of T-Shirt design using Adobe Photoshop, from the fundamentals to advanced techniques. Whether you're a complete beginner or seeking to refine your skills, this course caters to all levels of expertise.

What You'll Learn:

  • Master the Essentials of Photoshop: Gain a thorough understanding of Photoshop's interface, tools, and functionalities, enabling you to navigate the software with ease.

  • Explore Design Principles: Delve into the fundamental principles of design, including color theory, typography, composition, and balance, empowering you to create visually appealing and effective T-Shirt designs.

  • Conceptualize and Sketch Your Designs: Learn how to transform your creative ideas into tangible concepts and translate them into effective sketches, laying the groundwork for your T-Shirt designs.

  • Harness Photoshop's Power: Utilize Photoshop's extensive features to bring your designs to life. Master techniques such as layer management, selection tools, masking, and adjustments to create professional-looking T-Shirts.

  • Create Distressed and Vintage Looks: Learn how to achieve a variety of artistic effects, such as distressed and vintage looks, to add depth and character to your T-Shirt designs.

  • Master Realistic Textures: Discover techniques for creating realistic textures, such as fabric textures and leather textures, to enhance the visual appeal of your T-Shirt designs.

  • Optimize Designs for Print: Ensure your designs are print-ready by understanding color separation, resolution, and file formats specific to T-Shirt printing.

  • Industry Insights and Tips: Gain valuable insights into the T-Shirt design industry, including industry trends, marketing strategies, and tips for success.

Who Should Take This Course:

  • Aspiring T-Shirt designers seeking to master the art of T-Shirt design using Adobe Photoshop

  • Individuals with basic Photoshop knowledge looking to enhance their skills and create professional-level T-Shirt designs

  • Creative individuals passionate about fashion and design who want to express themselves through T-Shirt designs

Prerequisites:

  • A basic understanding of computers and the ability to navigate files and folders

  • A computer with Adobe Photoshop installed

  • A passion for creativity and a desire to learn T-Shirt design

Course Benefits:

  • Gain the skills and knowledge to create professional-looking T-Shirt designs using Adobe Photoshop

  • Develop a strong understanding of design principles and techniques

  • Expand your creative horizons and express your unique style through T-Shirt designs

  • Learn how to market and sell your T-Shirt designs effectively

  • Enhance your career prospects in the T-Shirt design industry

Individuals with basic Photoshop knowledge looking to enhance their skills and create professional-level T-Shirt designs

courseDetails.title: Design Thinking Guide for Successful Professionals
courseDetails.shortDescription: Success Formula for Entrepreneurs, Business Owners and Professionals
courseDetails.longDescription:
Design Thinking 3.0 - The #1 BEST-SELLING Design Thinking Course! (with over 800 ratings)


>> COURSE REGULARLY UPDATED (Last updated:  FEBRUARY 2024): NEW TIPS, MORE LESSONS <<

>> CERTIFIED COACH, SPEAKER, AND TRAINER <<

>> OVER 346,000 STUDENTS IN TOTAL <<


Design thinking is the most understudied concept as it has actually been around for a very long time but it is never really been explored to its huge potential for the betterment of the business or organization. Organizations like Apple and Google use the concept of design thinking in their day-to-day customer interface and thus have been able to design full-proof products which only have one outcome “Success”.

In the past, design has most often occurred fairly far downstream in the development process and has focused on making new products aesthetically attractive or enhancing brand perception through smart, evocative advertising. Today, as innovation’s terrain expands to encompass human-centered processes and services as well as products, companies are asking designers to create ideas rather than simply dress them up.


Everything around you has been designed in an attempt to delight you. And as customers when you are delighted with the product and you are eager to buy it, it doesn’t matter how expensive it is and thus companies/businesses which is capable of producing such products become the CUSTOMER FAVORITE. 


In this course, you will learn the complete design thinking process and its various components. I have discussed each and every part of the process in detail and with examples and stories to make your understanding concrete. It’s my BOLD promise that the tools and techniques that I have discussed in this course can transform your business and has the potential to give you a huge breakthrough in your professional life.


Are you a Non-Profit or Charity helping the world?

Awesome! The world needs more people like you. Keep up the good work and let me know how I can help. To start with, get in touch with me to unlock free access to all of my courses. Just message me privately and I'll get that sorted for you and your team.
targetAudiences: This course is for Entrepreneurs, Business Owners and Managers who are willing to work towards creating a customer favorite product

MTF R&D center focused on research activities at areas: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Cryptocurrency & Digital Assets, Metaverses, Digital Transformation, Fintech, Electronic Commerce, Internet of Things.

MTF is the official partner of: IBM, Intel, Microsoft, member of the Portuguese Chamber of Commerce and Industry, and resident of the incubator "The Fintech House of Portugal".

MTF is present in 202 countries and has been chosen by more than 180,000 students.


What you'll learn

● Introduction to branding and its stages, key elements and types

● Branding strategies

● Brand portfolio and brand architecture

● Brand identification

● Communication in branding

● Brand capital

● Brand value


You will know about: brand management and it’s stages; how to create a brand platform and use it; branding strategies; brand portfolio and brand architecture; brand identification; how to implement communication in branding; how to create and evaluate brand capital and brand value.


Course Full Description and Welcome Letter:

Hello!

This online course is designed for beginners and for the ones who already have experience in marketing and management, but want to improve their skills and make changes in companies.

This course contains a lot of information for leveling up the skill and knowledge, and helps to know new methods, examples, techniques and approaches, which you can use in brand management.


The Professional Diploma in Branding and Brand Management is a program designed to equip students with the knowledge and skills necessary to excel in the dynamic field of branding. In today's competitive business landscape, building and managing strong brands is crucial for success. This course delves into the fundamental principles, strategies, and practical applications of branding, preparing students for rewarding careers in brand management, marketing, and communication.


Course Modules:

  1. Introduction to Branding and its Stages, Key Elements, and Types

    • Explore the origins and evolution of branding

    • Identify the key elements that make up a brand

    • Examine different types of brands, including personal branding

  2. Branding Strategies

    • Analyze various branding strategies employed by successful companies

    • Develop a deep understanding of brand positioning and differentiation

    • Study the importance of consumer perception and emotional connection in branding

  3. Brand Portfolio and Brand Architecture

    • Learn how to manage multiple brands within a portfolio

    • Understand the concept of brand architecture and its role in brand management

    • Explore strategies for optimizing brand portfolios to maximize value

  4. Brand Identification

    • Dive into the process of creating a strong brand identity

    • Discover how to ensure consistency across all brand touchpoints

  5. Communication in Branding

    • Master the art of effective brand communication

    • Study advertising, content marketing, and social media in brand promotion

    • Develop skills in crafting compelling brand narratives and messaging

  6. Brand Capital

    • Explore the concept of brand equity and its components

    • Analyze the financial implications of strong brand capital

    • Learn how to measure and enhance brand capital over time

  7. Brand Value

    • Understand the factors that contribute to the overall value of a brand

    • Examine case studies of successful brand valuation

    • Learn how to leverage brand value for business growth and sustainability


Importance of Learning Branding and Brand Management for Companies:

  1. Competitive Advantage: In a crowded marketplace, a strong brand can set a company apart from its competitors. Effective branding helps businesses define their unique value propositions and create a lasting impression on consumers.

  2. Customer Loyalty: Brands that resonate with consumers build trust and loyalty. Brand management ensures that a company consistently delivers on its promises, fostering long-term relationships with customers.

  3. Brand Equity: A well-managed brand can have a significant financial impact. It can command premium prices, attract investors, and even serve as collateral for loans, contributing to a company's overall value.

  4. Effective Marketing: Branding provides a foundation for marketing strategies. It simplifies decision-making by providing a clear direction for marketing campaigns, making them more efficient and effective.

  5. Innovation and Adaptation: Brand management involves monitoring consumer trends and feedback. Companies can use this information to adapt and innovate their products and services, staying relevant in a constantly changing market.

  6. Crisis Management: A strong brand can act as a shield during crises. Companies with established brands are often better equipped to weather PR disasters and recover more quickly.

Importance of Learning Branding and Brand Management for Experts:

  1. Career Opportunities: Branding professionals are in high demand across various industries. Learning the art of branding opens up a wide range of career opportunities, from brand management and marketing to advertising and public relations.

  2. High Earning Potential: Professionals with expertise in branding and brand management often command higher salaries due to the strategic role they play in a company's success. Brands are valuable assets, and those who can manage them effectively are highly sought after.

  3. Versatility: Branding skills are transferable across industries. This versatility allows experts to work in diverse fields, from consumer goods to technology, healthcare, and even personal branding for individuals.

  4. Creative Expression: Branding offers a unique blend of creativity and strategy. Experts in this field have the opportunity to work on creative projects, such as designing logos, crafting brand stories, and developing compelling advertising campaigns.

  5. Global Reach: Brands often have a global presence. Professionals in branding have the opportunity to work on international projects and collaborate with teams from around the world, broadening their horizons and experiences.

  6. Personal Branding: Learning branding can also benefit individuals. In today's digital age, personal branding is essential for career advancement. Understanding branding principles can help professionals build and manage their personal brand effectively.

Learning branding and brand management is not only crucial for companies to succeed in the market but also provides valuable career prospects for individuals. It equips professionals with skills that are in demand across industries and empowers them to create and manage brands that leave a lasting impact. Whether you are a company looking to strengthen your market position or an individual seeking to enhance your career, branding and brand management knowledge is a valuable asset.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. Course for any who want to build a career at marketing or improve their knowledge.

courseDetails.title: Essential Adobe Lightroom Course for Photo Editing
courseDetails.shortDescription: Capture the Essence of Photography: Unleash Your Creativity with Adobe Lightroom!
courseDetails.longDescription:
Do you have a DSLR and you want to learn raw photo or image editing professionally?

Do you want to learn the world’s most powerful and efficient editing application, used by professional photographers? If you are looking to learn Adobe Lightroom from the beginning than you are in right place. This is a beginner level course so we will learn from the very basic.

What is Adobe Lightroom Classic and how does it differ from normal Lightroom?

It's VERY important that you don't get confused by the two! Lightroom Classic, covered in this course, is a program that is used by photographers to view, sort, process and export their images for use elsewhere. Normal Lightroom is a cloud-based sharing program that then shares those exported files (or any other photos for that matter), between your devices - your computer, tablet and smartphone. Normal Lightroom is not covered in this course.

Lets take a look what you will learn from this course:

• Interface and Import

• Image Filter

• White Balance

• Tone

• Vibrance and Saturation

• Skin Retouch

• Spot Healing

• Color Correction

• Adjustment

• Presets

• Effects and more

During Learning if you face any issue than I am always there for you to help you.

Whether you have never used Lightroom or you have opened it and struggled - follow this course with me and together we will take your images and transform them into beautiful, dynamic photographs by using Adobe Lightroom CC.
targetAudiences: Beginner who want to learn Photo Editing in Light Room

courseDetails.title: Applied Cryptography with Python
courseDetails.shortDescription: Protecting Your Data
courseDetails.longDescription:
Are you interested in learning how to use cryptography to protect your data? Our Applied Cryptography with Python course is the perfect way to get started! This course will teach you the fundamentals of cryptography and how to apply them using Python.

Cryptography is a way of making sure that information is kept secret and secure. It is important for keeping information safe and is used by people all around the world. It is the art of keeping secrets. It's like a special code that only certain people can understand. It's used to keep sensitive information safe, like passwords, bank account numbers, and other important information. Cryptography is an important part of keeping our data and information safe.

In this course you will learn about Cryptography with Python. You'll learn how to protect your data from malicious attacks. You'll learn how to encrypt and decrypt data and create digital signatures. With our Applied Cryptography with Python course, you'll be able to confidently use cryptography to secure your data and protect your digital assets. Enroll now and start learning the essential skills you need to secure your data!

This is a beginners course, you don't need any prior knowledge of cryptography. But you should already be familiar with the Python programming language. Sign up now and start your journey on Applied Cryptography with the Python programming language.
targetAudiences: Beginner Python programmers

courseDetails.title: QuickBooks Desktop Multiple Currencies
courseDetails.shortDescription: Learn to record transactions using multiple currencies from a certified public accountant (CPA)
courseDetails.longDescription:
Learn how to get access to QuickBooks Desktop including a possible free 30-day trial version often offered by Intuit, the owner of QuickBooks Desktop.

The course will discuss accounting for multiple currencies, outlining the process in Excel to provide a more transparent look at the process. Then we will enter the transactions into QuickBooks, the software automating some of the steps required.

We will learn how to turn multicurrency on, and which accounts will be affected most by multicurrency transactions including cash account types, accounts receivable account types, and accounts payable account types.

Learners will work example problems related to the sales cycles and the purchases cycle, the sales cycle including foreign currency receivables, the purchases cycle including foreign currency payables.

We will also demonstrate transactions related to forward contracts, both for speculative purposes and to mitigate risk on foreign currency transactions.

The multiple currency feature is useful when the company is holding onto cash in a foreign currency, the software helping us to record the home currency equivalent for financial statement presentation.

Multiple currency functionality is also helpful when we make sales on account, sending an invoice, hoping to get paid in the future, tracking accounting receivable, but expecting to be paid in a foreign currency. The accounts receivable account will need to be valued in the home currency even though we will be paid in a foreign one.

We have a similar situation when we make purchases on account, promising to pay in a foreign currency at some point in the future. The accounts payable account will need to be valued in the home currency equivalence even though we will be paying in a foreign currency.
targetAudiences: Accountants
Bookkeepers
Business owners

courseDetails.title: GRE - GMAT | Advanced Learners | Math Marathon
courseDetails.shortDescription: Hundreds of medium to advanced level word problems of GRE & GMAT quantitative section
courseDetails.longDescription:
Elevate Your GRE & GMAT Prep to the Highest Level with Our Ultimate Test-Day Preparation Course!

Are you on the verge of taking the GRE or GMAT and want to ensure you're ready for every curveball the quantitative section might throw at you? Look no further! Our GRE & GMAT Ultimate Test-Day Prep Course is the final step in your journey towards conquering these exams.

Here's why this course is your passport to success:

  1. Mastering the Trickiest Concepts: Not every question in this course is a mind-boggler, and not all are a breeze. We've meticulously curated a collection of questions that delve into those sneaky concepts frequently tested in GRE and GMAT quantitative sections. This course isn't for beginners; it's for those with a basic understanding of word problem concepts.

  2. Complementary Courses: If you're just starting out, consider pairing this course with our GRE | Quantitative | Master Course or GMAT | Quantitative | Math Master Course to build a solid foundation.

  3. Tackling the Uncharted Territory: There are always those elusive concepts that don't neatly fit into defined GRE or GMAT categories. We've got them covered! We address these "grey areas" by providing 165 meticulously solved questions across four sections, covering percentages, ratios & proportions, averages, probability, geometry, rates, and IQ & logical-type questions.

  4. Shortcut Mastery: Most questions in this course are solved using clever shortcut techniques, while some are explained through both shortcuts and conventional methods. Understanding the logic behind shortcuts boosts your confidence on test day, even if you choose not to use them.

  5. A Journey of Growth: Our journey is just beginning! We're committed to expanding this course into a 50+ hour treasure trove with over 1000 GRE and GMAT level questions.

  6. Comprehensive Content: While we've started with problem-solving questions, our roadmap includes Quantitative Comparison and Data Sufficiency sections in the future.

This course is tailor-made for advanced-level students, featuring GRE content at the 320+ level and GMAT content at the 700+ level. It's your bridge to the score you've been aiming for.

Don't let the GRE and GMAT intimidate you. Join our Ultimate Test-Day Prep Course, and embark on the journey to GRE and GMAT success. Secure your spot today, and prepare to shine on test day!
targetAudiences: Students who are aiming for 700+ in GMAT and 325+ in GRE

Instructor speaks with Northern European accent.

courseDetails.title: QuickBooks Enterprise-Classes-Responsibility Accounting
courseDetails.shortDescription: Learn responsibility accounting using class tracking for both the balance sheet and profit and loss from a CPA
courseDetails.longDescription:
This course is a project-based course using the free trial version of QuickBooks Enterprise, practicing the feature of class tracking for both the balance sheet and profit and loss, the class tracking feature applied to responsibility accounting.

We will learn how to download the free trial version of QuickBooks Enterprise and set up a new company file to work in.

The course will show how to turn on the class tracking feature and discuss the differences between class tracking for the QuickBooks Pro version of the software and the QuickBooks Enterprise version.

We will record expenses by department using the class tracing feature and learn how to allocate indirect expenses.

The course will then demonstrate how to allocate service center expenses to revenue centers.

We will also consider adjustments to the balance sheet as we generate balance sheet reports by class.
targetAudiences: Accounting students
Accounting professionals
Bookkeepers

courseDetails.title: Individual Income Tax Form 1040 Comprehensive Problem
courseDetails.shortDescription: Construct a complex tax return step by step with a Certified Public Accountant CPA
courseDetails.longDescription:
This is a project based income tax course.

We will construct a complex tax return in a step by step format, beginning with a basic return & building complexity as we move forward.

The course will demonstrate the data input within 2020 income tax forms as well as the use of an Excel worksheet to check the numbers and demonstrate the use of tax software.

Using tax software & an Excel worksheet, formatted as the income tax equation, are common, and best practices for many tax professionals, practices that greatly increase understanding and accuracy.

The practice problem with start by using basic tax data input forms such as W-2 forms and Form 1099s. We will then add a Schedule A Itemized Deductions. The problem will eventually include a Schedule C Sole Proprietorship and Schedule E Rental Income or Loss.

The materials for the course will include example tax forms after many of the steps in the practice problem. We will also include an Excel worksheet template that will be used in the instructional videos.

We will be using Lacerte tax software. You are not required to have Lacerte tax software to follow along. If you do not have tax software you can still follow along using tax forms from the IRS website and use the Excel worksheet. Other tax software can also be used in a similar way.

In some cases Lacerte may offer a free 30-day trial period of the tax software.
targetAudiences: Tax Professionals
Tax Students
Individual Taxpayers

courseDetails.title: Excel, maîtrisez les compétences clés pour devenir expert !
courseDetails.shortDescription: Maîtriser Excel de A à Z par la pratique avec des exercices et des études de cas - Excel 2010, Excel 2013, Excel 2016
courseDetails.longDescription:
Maitriser Excel de A à Z


Ce cours a été créé pour répondre à trois objectifs principaux :

1. Vous accompagner dans la prise en main d‘Excel en vous donnant un socle de bases solides

2. Vous faire gagner en efficacité et en temps dans votre travail en vous faisant découvrir et manipuler tout un panel de fonctions et de fonctionnalités

3. Vous rendre autonome dans l’utilisation d’Excel en vous faisant comprendre la logique d’Excel


Pour atteindre ces objectifs, nous avons axé ce cours sur la pratique ! Pour chaque notion abordée, vous aurez une vidéo d'introduction, un exercice d'application et une vidéo de correction. Pour vous accompagner, des classeurs Excel et un guide sont téléchargeables.


Ce cours est composé de différentes niveaux vous permettant d'acquérir les fondamentaux dans Excel et de construire une base solide. Ces niveaux vous permettent d'aborder de manière progressive de nouvelles fonctionnalités et fonctions afin de pouvoir traiter et gérer des données mais aussi de les visualiser, les analyser et les communiquer de manière efficace et professionnelle.


Pour consolider les notions apprises, vous aurez une étude de cas tirée d'une situation réelle à la fin de chaque niveau.


Le cours a été développé sous Excel 2016. Cependant, toutes les fonctionnalités présentées fonctionnent sur Excel 2010, 2013, 2016 et Mac 2016. La plupart fonctionne sur Excel 2007.


A la fin de ce cours, vous serez autonome et comprendrez la logique d'Excel afin de gagner du temps et en efficacité dans votre utilisation de l'outil. Les points suivants ne vous seront plus étrangers et vous les maitriserez:

  • Fonctions logiques pour effectuer des tests

  • Fonctions Date permettant d'extraire et d'effectuer des opérations sur les dates

  • Fonctions texte permettant d'harmoniser des cellules, de modifier le contenu ou d'extraire des informations souhaitées

  • Les fonctionnalités du filtre

  • Fonctions conditionnelles pour effectuer des opérations mathématiques en fonction de vos conditions

  • La mise en forme graphique

  • La recherchev et la combinaison Index - Equiv

  • Les tableaux croisés dynamiques


N'attendez plus, inscrivez-vous pour devenir une experte ou un expert dans Excel !
targetAudiences: Débutants, intermédiaires et celles et ceux qui souhaitent acquérir une expertise solide
Utilisatrices et utilisateurs avec l'envie d'apprendre par la pratique

courseDetails.title: Introduction to Human Resources Management
courseDetails.shortDescription: Introduction to HR Management by MTF Institute: HR Partners, HR life cycle, Employee Journey Map, HR functionality

Learning about Human Resources Management (HRM) is crucial for both companies and individuals seeking to build a successful career. Here are several reasons why this topic is essential:


For Companies:

  1. Talent Acquisition: HRM is vital for recruiting and selecting the right talent for an organization. Effective HR practices help companies attract qualified individuals who can contribute to the company's growth and success.

  2. Retention: HRM strategies, such as employee engagement and development programs, can help retain valuable employees. High employee turnover can be costly, and HR can help reduce this by creating a positive work environment.

  3. Compliance: HR professionals ensure that companies comply with labor laws, regulations, and workplace safety standards. Non-compliance can lead to legal issues and reputational damage.

  4. Conflict Resolution: HR plays a pivotal role in resolving workplace conflicts and disputes, which, if left unchecked, can harm productivity and morale.

  5. Performance Management: HR helps in setting performance standards, conducting appraisals, and developing strategies to enhance employee performance. This ensures that employees are working efficiently to achieve the company's objectives.

  6. Training and Development: HR facilitates employee training and development programs. Well-trained employees are better equipped to handle their responsibilities and adapt to changes, ultimately benefiting the company.

  7. Employee Benefits and Compensation: HR manages compensation packages and benefits, ensuring that they are competitive in the market. This helps attract and retain top talent.

  8. Diversity and Inclusion: HR promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace, which fosters creativity, innovation, and a broader perspective in decision-making.

  9. Organizational Culture: HR plays a significant role in shaping the company's culture. A positive culture can improve employee satisfaction, motivation, and overall performance.

  10. Strategic Planning: HR professionals contribute to the company's strategic planning by aligning HR practices with the organization's goals, ensuring that human capital is leveraged effectively.


For Individuals Building a Career:

  1. Career Opportunities: Understanding HRM principles can open up career opportunities in HR departments of various companies, consulting firms, or as an independent HR consultant.

  2. Soft Skills Development: HRM involves honing soft skills such as communication, conflict resolution, and interpersonal skills, which are valuable in any career.

  3. Career Advancement: HR knowledge can help individuals advance in their careers, especially if they aim for leadership or managerial roles where people management skills are critical.

  4. Problem-Solving: HR professionals often deal with complex issues, requiring problem-solving skills. Learning HRM equips individuals with these skills that are transferable to other roles.

  5. Understanding Workplace Dynamics: Understanding HRM helps individuals navigate workplace dynamics, making it easier to build relationships, resolve conflicts, and thrive in their current positions.

  6. Ethical Decision-Making: HRM often involves ethical decision-making, which is a valuable skill in any profession. Learning about ethical considerations in HR can help individuals make sound ethical choices in their careers.

  7. Self-Management: HRM principles often emphasize self-awareness and self-management, skills that contribute to personal growth and career success.

Learning about Human Resources Management is important for both companies and individuals. For companies, effective HRM practices can lead to a motivated, skilled, and engaged workforce, which is crucial for success. For individuals, HRM knowledge can open doors to rewarding career opportunities and equip them with essential skills applicable across various professions.
